meanings.definition: The act of entering or going in.
meanings.sent1: The ingresses to the building were wide and welcoming.
meanings.sent2: We found multiple ingresses to the park, each leading to a different area.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to use the tiny ingresses in the fence as a shortcut.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the ingresses to his heart, opening up a world of happiness.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious cave had hidden ingresses that only the locals knew about.

meanings.definition: A means or place of entering; an entrance.
meanings.sent1: The grand ingresses of the palace were adorned with intricate carvings.
meanings.sent2: The main ingresses to the stadium were crowded with excited fans.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat by the ingresses to the garden, waiting for a chance to sneak in.
meanings.sent4: The old wooden door served as the ingresses to a world of forgotten memories.
meanings.sent5: The ancient temple had hidden ingresses that only the chosen ones could find.
